intro: Ferulago sandrasica, commonly known as the sandrasica fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, slightly bitter aroma. Ferulago sandrasica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
